title: XP setup doesn't start if there is an ext3 partition

forumNotes.author: mr_
forumNotes.content:
XP setup doesn't start if there is an ext3 partition. Also ubcd4win doesn't start.  

The partitions are currently 100 MB ext3, 10 GB NTFS, 2 GB FAT32, 10 GB NTFS. I wanted later to install grub4dos into the ext3 partition so it's unreadable for XP (and XP not touching the bootloader).  

The setup/ubcd4win starts but after a while the HDD laser diode shines, display is on and black and nothing happens anymore.

forumNotes.author: ktp
forumNotes.content:
What is the active partition? Are all partitions primary?  
If you set the NTFS partition primary, I think there would be no problem.

forumNotes.author: mr_
forumNotes.content:
> What is the active partition?
There was none.  

> Are all partitions primary?
Yes.  

> If you set the NTFS partition primary, I think there would be no problem.
Tested it, same result. I even created everything from scratch again. Forgot to mention, currently it's only a pretest in VMware but it shouldn't matter.

forumNotes.author: tcns
forumNotes.content:
I ran into this before. If my memory serves me right, I got it to work by using SETUPLDR.BIN from XP SP1.  

It just about drove me crazy trying to figure it out.  

Hope this helps.

forumNotes.author: Slesa
forumNotes.content: My personally results were that Windows does not like to be second on a stick. When I used a partition table like 1) Fat32/ntfs 2) ext3 it worked. With 1) ext3 2) Fat32 it didn't.
